intro: Telminostelma corymbosum, commonly known as the clustered spikevetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in grassy habitats and is often found in open areas with well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which attract pollinators such as bees. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
